Team

Engineering students building electric performance

EMUS is an engineering student team from Université de Sherbrooke building a fully electric race bike for MotoStudent 2027.

Who we are

Students building a competitive electric prototype

Multidisciplinary students in mechanical, electrical, controls, software, and business collaborate to design, build, and test a fully electric race bike for MotoStudent 2027.

We mix classroom theory with track-ready engineering: from chassis and battery design to testing and race operations.

Team structure

Leads and units

Electrical & Control Systems

ECU & Control Systems

Alexandre Blais

ECU development, control logic, and system integration.

ECU & Battery Systems

Julien Laflèche

Control software, battery integration, and validation.

Data Acquisition & Active Aero

Zachary Rodrigue

Test data logging and support for active aerodynamic systems.

Dyno Systems

Félix Jacques

Development and operation of dynamometer systems.

Thermal Systems

Maxime Boucher

Thermal management and electronic integration.

Thermal Systems

Alexandre Duchesne

Thermal integration and system optimization.

Drive & Rider Interface

Renaud Gagnon

Rider controls and drive system integration.

Drive & Rider Interface

Jérémy Marcoux

Development of rider interfaces and ergonomics.

Drive Systems

Thomas Giroux

Drive systems integration and validation.

Mechanical & Powertrain

Powertrain & Dyno Engineer

Émile Raymond

Powertrain development, dyno systems, and transmission support.

Aerodynamics & Vehicle Performance

Cooling & Aerodynamics

Alexandre Giguère

Mechanical cooling systems and aerodynamic integration.

Aerodynamics

Charles-Éric Blais

Aerodynamic analysis, design, and validation.

Chassis, Structure & Manufacturing

Structural Design

Philippe Gariépy

Frame and structural component design.

Structure & Aerodynamics

Nicolas Bernard

Structural design and aerodynamic hardware integration.

Race Operations & Outreach

Concept Research & Marketing

William Roy

Exploratory concept research and marketing strategy.

Marketing & Communications

Aymrik Rodrigue

Communications, outreach, and sponsor relations.
